title: A treatise of the sacraments according to the doctrin of the Church of England touching that argument Collected out of the articles of religion, the publique catechism, the liturgie, and the book of homilies. With a sermon preached in the publique lecture, appointed for Saint Pauls Crosse, on the feast of Saint Iohn Baptist, Iune 24. 1638. / By T.B. Pr. Pl.
author: Bedford, Thomas, d. 1653.
publisher: Printed by Richard Bishop [and E.G[riffin]], for Abel Roper, and are to bee sold at his shop, at the black spred eagle in Fleetstreet, over against S. Dunstans Church,
notes: In two parts; part 1 is subdivided into 3 parts.
Additional printer's name from the title page of part 2.
Part 2 has separate title page, which reads: The ready way to true freedom.
Part 2 is identified as STC 1787a on UMI microfilm, reel 719.
Reproductions of the originals in the Presbyterian Historical Society, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (part 1 only) and the Folger Shakespeare Library (part 2 only).
Appears at reel 1227 (Presbyterian Historical Society, part 1 only) and at reel 719 (Folger Library, part 2 only).
